physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It features a group of soldiers, all wearing military uniform,m gathered casually outside of a roofed housing. There are twelve men in the photograph. There are several small scratches on the photograph, but no tears or folds are seen.
sgcool_label_text: A variety of portraits of British soldiers that show them at leisure as well as two photographs of James Steele placing a wreath at a remembrance ceremony, this collection is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
title_text: Group of 50 photographs of P.O.W James Steele and regiment when stationed in Malaysia in 1941 (and 2 later photographs of Steele placing a wreath at ceremony of remembrance)  And some 280 boys, Singapore 1941 Group of soldiers outside dwelling
subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Soldiers Portraits, Group Photography
context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
